abstracts.cdata!:
The Highway Maintenance Project is an
            emergency operation in the road transport sector, a top
            priority in Chad s post-war reconstruction effort. It
            assists the Ministries of Public Works and Transport to
            rebuild their capacity to rehabilitate and maintain the
            country s high priority network, address important
            institution building objectives in the transport sector,
            help resolve constraints on the efficiency and
            competitiveness of the road transport industry, and
            coordinate and complement other donor s activities in the
            sector. The principal components include: 1) routinely
            maintaining of up to 2000 km of high priority roads; 2)
            rehabilitating and routinely maintaining a road linking the
            industrial center of N djamena with the country s primary
            road network; 3) rehabilitating the ferry at Moissala and
            replacing the ferry at Onoko, and constructing short access
            roads; 4) rebuilding the bridge at Lere and constructing
            access roads; 5) providing buildings and equipment to
            support the priority program for routine maintenance; and 6)
            undertaking studies and giving technical assistance to
            support project implementation and preparing a follow-up
            operation in the sector.
